basics.name: Luke Smith
basics.label: Software Developer
basics.summary:
I fell in love with software engineering because every problem has multiple solutions and finding the right one requires both creativity amid constraint.

Most of my career has been in security-focused development, where I've learned to balance moving fast with building things right. Working on Endpoint Detection & Response (EDR) tooling taught me what it really means to design for scale, not just handling millions of events, but doing it reliably when systems and threats are constantly evolving. I'm drawn to environments where curiosity isn't just welcomed, it's required.

I bring the same security-first mindset to how I work with teams: building trust through transparency, clear communication, and shared accountability.

work.name: AWS Security
responsibilities: Engineered automated agent validation platform using Python and React that tested 3 endpoint security agents across Windows, macOS, and Linux, catching 5+ critical production bugs eliminating 40+ hours of manual testing per release cycle and preventing faulty releases to 100K+ production endpoints. Becoming the standard testing suite for all new security endpoint agents to be deployed.

Architected hybrid cloud/physical testing infrastructure with configurable performance test suites and role-based UI, enabling 3 security teams to self-service validation with custom parameters, real-time resource monitoring, and automated reporting.

Engineered stream processing platform using Kinesis, Lambda, and DynamoDB to process 600K+ messages hourly from 100K+ endpoints, reducing infrastructure costs by 90% ($10K+ to <$1K monthly), Lambda execution by 90%, and third-party API usage by 80% while improving delivery latency from 15+ minutes to 3 seconds.

Developed platform API solving endpoint-to-user correlation reducing misfired security actions by 90% (200 to 20/min) and enabling 4 teams to leverage real-time availability data for time-critical security operations.

Developed API orchestration layer for secure employee offboarding platform, managing 2K+ monthly file retrieval requests with async workflows, agent-scripted file retrieval, and state management for security review queues serving 10+ part-time reviewers.

Engineered secure file handling pipeline with automated IP/malware filtering, manual review UI with file previews, role-based access controls, and comprehensive audit logging, ensuring compliant personal data release while emitting metrics on review times, request volume, and denial rates.

work.name: AWS Security
responsibilities: Migrated physical network monitoring infrastructure to serverless AWS architecture, replacing ~200 physical hosts across ~100 locations with fixed-response ALBs deployed to 25 AWS regions, eliminating ~$144K in annual hosting costs and ~1 day of maintenance per sprint in operational overhead with equivalent test coverage.

Led maintenance and expansion of network meta-monitoring system, growing coverage from 3 to 7 security services and providing visibility into monitoring blind spots that detected weekly outages; delivered critical VPN endpoint health metrics during remote work transition enabling network team to maintain remote workforce stability.
Drove team adoption of development standards, including code practices, sprint optimizations, and design improvements such as drift detection and rolling deployments in production.

work.name: Workday
responsibilities: Enhanced implementation of open-source language recognizer, ANTLR, used to define Workday’s Query Language and eventual data retrieval on Workday’s Platform.
Exposed REST-based Web Endpoints for allowing 3rd party systems to request data in support of Workday’s PaaS initiative.
Provided JavaScript front end to demonstrate REST Service API service capabilities.
All work followed standard software engineering practices such as documentation, code reviews and use of source control systems (VCS/Artifactory).

work.name: Microsoft
responsibilities: As part of Windows Azure Active Directory Test team, I gained experience using MVC architecture pattern and front-end design.
My project was to complete an End to End application that would test the capabilities of Windows Azure. This involved planning, writing the specifications, and developing the application.

projects.name: Obsidian Side Note
projects.description: Lightweight macOS notes app that floats over all windows and syncs instantly with your Obsidian vault. Designed to capture quick thoughts without leaving your current workspace.
